snippet.textDisplay: I distinctly remember one of my playthroughs of Pokemon Trading Card Game I made this uber-awesome Fire-Grass themed deck which focused primarily on Fire and Bug-type Pokemon and I remember just steamrolling many opponents with a Beedrill I had in that deck.

snippet.textDisplay: +R4d0m Human I was one of the few at my school who actually knew how to play to begin with. Kind of annoying, actually, because I had nobody to play against as a result! The game just helped me improve a lot... although it did help me discover the power of the Rain Dance deck and the usefulness of Professor Oak and Bill cards. (If only I had enough money to set myself up with that many uncommons and rares - and people to play it with! though there was that one guy I used to play all the time) This game was a rare gem, though, surprisingly fun. Even if there were way too many freaking coin tosses.
snippet.textOriginal: +R4d0m Human I was one of the few at my school who actually knew how to play to begin with. Kind of annoying, actually, because I had nobody to play against as a result! The game just helped me improve a lot... although it did help me discover the power of the Rain Dance deck and the usefulness of Professor Oak and Bill cards. (If only I had enough money to set myself up with that many uncommons and rares - and people to play it with! though there was that one guy I used to play all the time) This game was a rare gem, though, surprisingly fun. Even if there were way too many freaking coin tosses.

snippet.textDisplay:
I loved this game when I was a kid. Hell, I used to collect Pokemon trading cards, yet I had no idea how to play the game... until I played this game! So many good memories with this game. I eventually found myself just dueling against the same NPCs again and again in my completed file, and still having fun. 

This game also had a great soundtrack with lots of memorable tunes! <3
snippet.textOriginal:
I loved this game when I was a kid. Hell, I used to collect Pokemon trading cards, yet I had no idea how to play the game... until I played this game! So many good memories with this game. I eventually found myself just dueling against the same NPCs again and again in my completed file, and still having fun. 

This game also had a great soundtrack with lots of memorable tunes! <3

snippet.textDisplay: Back from a healthy vacation, got to recharge my battery and I'm now ready for the start of my favorite time of the year: May to September. I love Summer. E3 being around the corner is also always exciting. Anyways, Pokemon TCG was a great little game with a surprisingly solid soundtrack, though I was more addicted to the real Pokemon card game at the time. Good times!
snippet.textOriginal: Back from a healthy vacation, got to recharge my battery and I'm now ready for the start of my favorite time of the year: May to September. I love Summer. E3 being around the corner is also always exciting. Anyways, Pokemon TCG was a great little game with a surprisingly solid soundtrack, though I was more addicted to the real Pokemon card game at the time. Good times!

snippet.textDisplay: Such a great game... when I was a kid, I was so sad when I found out I lost it on vacation. Must've left it in the rental house, hopefully for some other kid to pick up, and have the time of their lives with. I somehow liked this game more than the actual trading card game. I suppose it's because I wasn't a social kid, and I liked getting the sense that I was good at something, even when I wasn't really.
snippet.textOriginal: Such a great game... when I was a kid, I was so sad when I found out I lost it on vacation. Must've left it in the rental house, hopefully for some other kid to pick up, and have the time of their lives with. I somehow liked this game more than the actual trading card game. I suppose it's because I wasn't a social kid, and I liked getting the sense that I was good at something, even when I wasn't really.
